analyzed: cūḷa niddesa
translated: The Shorter Expositions

analyzed: pārāyana vagga niddesa
translated: The Exposition of the Pārāyanavagga

analyzed: pucchā niddesa
translated: The Exposition of the Questions

analyzed: jatu kaṇṇi māṇava pucchā niddesa
translated: The Exposition of the Questions of the Youth Jatukaṇṇi

analyzed: sutvān aham vīram akāma kāmi
translated: Having heard the hero who is free from passion and desire,

analyzed: id ca ayasmai
translated: (so said the venerable Jatukaṇṇi)

analyzed: ogha atigam puṭṭhum akāmam āgama
translated: I have come to ask the one who has crossed the floods, who is free from passion and desire,

analyzed: santipadam brūhi
translated: Please tell me, O Leader of the people,

analyzed: yathātaccham bhagavān brūhi mā ita
translated: The truth, O Blessed One, please tell me this.

original: Sutvānahaṁ vīramakāmakāminti sutvā suṇitvā uggahetvā upadhāretvā upalakkhayitvā.
analyzed: sutvāna aham vīram a kāma kāmin ti sutvā suṇitvā uggahetvā upadhāretvā upalakkhayitvā
translated: Having heard the hero who is free from passion and desire: having heard, having listened, having received, having grasped, having attended, having observed.

original: Itipi so bhagavā arahaṁ …pe… buddho bhagavāti—
analyzed: saḥ bhagavā araham pe buddhaḥ bhagavā iti
translated: He is the Blessed One, the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One...

analyzed: sutvān aha
translated: Having heard.

analyzed: vīranti vīraḥ bhagavān
translated: Hero: the Blessed One is a hero.

original: Vīriyavāti vīro, pahūti vīro, visavīti vīro, alamattoti vīro, sūroti vīro, vikkanto abhīrū acchambhī anutrāsī apalāyī pahīnabhayabheravo vigatalomahaṁsoti vīro.
analyzed: vīriyavāti vīro pahūti vīraḥ visavīti vīraḥ alamattoti vīro sūraḥ iti vīraḥ vikkantaḥ abhīruḥ acchambhī anutrāsī apalāyī pahīna bhaya bheravaḥ vigata loma hasaḥ iti vīro
translated: He is a hero because of energy, he is a hero because of abundance, he is a hero because of being unequalled, he is a hero because of being sufficient, he is a hero because of being free, he is a hero because of being fearless, untimid, unafraid, not fleeing, having abandoned fear and terror, with hair and skin standing up through joy.

analyzed: virataḥ idha sabba pāpakehi
translated: He is a hero because of being restrained here from all evil,

analyzed: niraya dukkham aticca vīriya vāso
translated: The one with energy who has crossed over the suffering of hell,

analyzed: saḥ vīriyavā padhānavā
translated: He is the one with energy, the one with effort,🔽Such a hero is called that way.

analyzed: pavuccate tathattā ati  sutvān aham vīra
translated: Having heard the hero.

analyzed: a kāma kāmin iti
translated: Free from passion and desire:

analyzed: kāmā ati uddānataḥ dve kāmā
translated: “Sensual desires”: there are two kinds of sensual desires, according to the summary verses.

analyzed: vatthu kāmā ca kilesa kāmā ca pe
translated: Sensual desires as objects and sensual desires as defilements.

analyzed: ime vuccanti vatthu kāmā pe
translated: These are called sensual desires as objects.

analyzed: ime vuccanti kilesa kāmā
translated: These are called sensual desires as defilements.

original: Buddhassa bhagavato vatthukāmā pariññātā, kilesakāmā pahīnā.
analyzed: buddhassa bhagavataḥ vatthu kāmā pariññātā kilesa kāmā pahīnā
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, has fully understood sensual desires as objects and abandoned sensual desires as defilements.

original: Vatthukāmānaṁ pariññātattā kilesakāmānaṁ pahīnattā bhagavā na kāme kāmeti, na kāme pattheti, na kāme piheti, na kāme abhijappati.
analyzed: vatthu kāmānam pariññāta ttā kilesa kāmānam pahīna ttā bhagavā na kāme kāmeti na kāme pattheti na kāme piheti na kāme abhijappati
translated: Because he has fully understood sensual desires as objects and abandoned sensual desires as defilements, the Blessed One does not desire sensual desires, does not long for sensual desires, does not approve of sensual desires, does not burn with sensual desires.

original: Ye kāme kāmenti, kāme patthenti, kāme pihenti, kāme abhijappanti, te kāmakāmino rāgarāgino saññāsaññino.
analyzed: ye kāme kāmenti kāme patthenti kāme pihenti kāme abhijappanti te kāma kāminaḥ rāga rāginaḥ saññā saññinaḥ
translated: Those who desire sensual desires, who long for sensual desires, who approve of sensual desires, who burn with sensual desires, are called sensualists, are called lustful, are called those who have sensual desires.

original: Bhagavā na kāme kāmeti, na kāme pattheti, na kāme piheti, na kāme abhijappati.
analyzed: bhagavā na kāme kāmeti na kāme pattheti na kāme piheti na kāme abhijappati
translated: The Blessed One does not desire sensual desires, does not long for sensual desires, does not approve of sensual desires, does not burn with sensual desires.

original: Tasmā buddho akāmo nikkāmo cattakāmo vantakāmo muttakāmo pahīnakāmo paṭinissaṭṭhakāmo
analyzed: tasmā buddhaḥ akāmaḥ nikkāmaḥ catta kāmaḥ vanta kāmaḥ mutta kāmaḥ pahīna kāmaḥ paṭinissaṭṭha kāmaḥ
translated: Therefore the Buddha is one without sensual desires, one who has renounced sensual desires, one who has cut off sensual desires, one who is detached from sensual desires, one who has destroyed sensual desires, one who has abandoned sensual desires, one who has emitted sensual desires, one who is free from sensual desires.

original: vītarāgo vigatarāgo cattarāgo vantarāgo muttarāgo pahīnarāgo paṭinissaṭṭharāgo nicchāto
analyzed: vīta rāgaḥ vigata rāgaḥ catta rāgaḥ vanta rāgaḥ mutta rāgaḥ pahīna rāgaḥ paṭinissaṭṭha rāgaḥ nicchātaḥ
translated: He is free from passion, free from hatred, free from delusion, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, free from passion, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred, and delusion, free from lust, passion, and desire, free from passion, hatred,

original: nibbuto sītibhūto sukhappaṭisaṁvedī brahmabhūtena attanā viharatīti—🔽sutvānahaṁ vīra amakāmakāmiṁ.
analyzed: nibbutaḥ sīti bhūtaḥ sukha ppaṭisavedī brahma bhūtena attanā viharati iti  sutvān aham vīra ama kāma kāmi
translated: Having heard that, I came to you, O Hero,

analyzed: id ca ayasmai jatukaṇṇī iti  i ca ati pada sandhi pe pada anupubba tā apeta
translated: So said the venerable Jatukaṇṇi.🔽So said: this is a phrase that links the meaning …

analyzed: i t ca ati
translated: So said: this is a word that links the meaning.

analyzed: āyasmā iti piya vacanam āyasmā iti
translated: Venerable: this is a word of endearment, a word of respect, a word of esteem.

original: Jatukaṇṇīti tassa brāhmaṇassa gottaṁ saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāroti—
analyzed: jatukaṇṇī iti tassa brāhmaṇassa gottam saṅkhā samaññā paññatti vohāraḥ ti
translated: Jatukaṇṇi: this is the brahmin’s clan, his designation, his appellation, his description.

analyzed: id ca ayasmai  ogha atigam puṭṭhum akāmam āgamanti
translated: So said the venerable Jatukaṇṇi.🔽To ask about the one who has gone beyond the flood, who has no desire.

original: Oghātiganti oghātigaṁ oghaṁ atikkantaṁ samatikkantaṁ vītivattanti—
analyzed: ogha atigam ti ogha atigam ogham atikkantam samatikkantam vītivattanti
translated: Gone beyond the flood: the one who has gone beyond the flood, who has gone beyond and crossed over the flood, who has passed beyond the flood.

analyzed: ogha atiga
translated: Gone beyond the flood.

original: Puṭṭhunti puṭṭhuṁ pucchituṁ yācituṁ ajjhesituṁ pasādetuṁ.🔽Akāmamāgamanti akāmaṁ puṭṭhuṁ nikkāmaṁ cattakāmaṁ vantakāmaṁ muttakāmaṁ pahīnakāmaṁ
analyzed: puṭṭhum ti puṭṭhum pucchitum yācitum ajjhesitum pasādetu  akāmam āgamanti akāmam puṭṭhum nikkāmam catta kāmam vanta kāmam mutta kāmam pahīna kāma
translated: To ask: to ask, to question, to request, to invite, to have confidence in.🔽Who has no desire: who has no desire to ask, who has no desire to question, who has no desire to request, who has no desire to invite, who has no desire to have confidence in.🔽Who has no desire to ask, who has no desire to question, who has no desire to request, who has no desire to invite, who has no desire to have confidence in.

original: paṭinissaṭṭhakāmaṁ vītarāgaṁ vigatarāgaṁ cattarāgaṁ vantarāgaṁ muttarāgaṁ pahīnarāgaṁ
analyzed: paṭinissaṭṭha kāmam vīta rāgam vigata rāgam catta rāgam vanta rāgam mutta rāgam pahīna rāga
translated: Who has no desire to ask, who has no desire to question, who has no desire to request, who has no desire to invite, who has no desire to have confidence in.🔽Who has no desire to ask, who has no desire to question, who has no desire to request, who has no desire to invite, who has no desire to have confidence in.🔽Who has no desire to ask, who has no desire to question, who has no desire to request, who has no desire to invite, who has no desire to have confidence in.🔽Who has no desire to ask, who has no desire to question, who has no desire to request, who has no desire to invite, who has no desire to have confidence in.🔽Who has no desire to ask, who has no desire to question, who has no desire to request, who has no desire to invite, who has no desire to have confidence in.🔽Who has no desire to ask, who has no desire to question, who has no desire to request, who has no desire to invite, who has no desire to have confidence

original: paṭinissaṭṭharāgaṁ āgamhā āgatamhā upāgatamhā sampattamhā tayā saddhiṁ samāgatamhāti—
analyzed: paṭinissaṭṭha rāgam āgamhā āgatamhā upāgatamhā sampattamhā tayā saddhim samāgatamhā iti
translated: we have come to you, we have arrived, we have reached you, we have met you, we have come together with you.

analyzed: ogha atigam puṭṭhum akāmam āgama
translated: We have come to ask you to cross the flood.

analyzed: santipadam brūhi
translated: Tell us the peaceful state, the eye of the world.”

original: Santīti ekena ākārena santipi santipadampi taṁyeva amataṁ nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: santi iti ekena ākārena tayā iva amatam nibbāna
translated: Peaceful: in one way, it is peaceful and it is the peaceful state. That is the deathless, Nibbāna.

original: Yo so sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhakkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ sabba saṅkhāra samatho sabba upadhi paṭinissaggo taṇhā khayaḥ virāgaḥ nirodhaḥ nibbāna
translated: It is the stilling of all processes, the relinquishing of all acquisitions, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, Nibbāna.

analyzed: vuttam ha etam bhagavatā
translated: For this is said by the Blessed One:

original: “santametaṁ padaṁ, paṇītametaṁ padaṁ, yadidaṁ sabbasaṅkhārasamatho sabbūpadhipaṭinissaggo taṇhakkhayo virāgo nirodho nibbānan”ti.🔽Athāparenākārena ye dhammā santādhigamāya santiphusanāya santisacchikiriyāya saṁvattanti, seyyathidaṁ—
analyzed: santam etam pada paṇītam etam pada yat idam sabba saṅkhāra samatho sabba upadhi paṭinissaggo taṇhā khayaḥ virāgaḥ nirodhaḥ nibbānanti  atha aparena ākārena ye dhammā santādhigamāya santiphusanāya santi sacchikiriyāya savattanti sā iyyathida
translated: “This state is peaceful, this state is sublime, that is, the stilling of all processes, the relinquishing of all acquisitions, the destruction of craving, dispassion, cessation, Nibbāna.”

original: cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañcindriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjhaṅgā ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo—
analyzed: cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañca indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjhaṅgāḥ ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo
translated: Then in another way, those things that lead to the attainment of the peaceful, to the touching of the peaceful, to the realization of the peaceful, are the four foundations of mindfulness, the four right kinds of striving, the four bases for spiritual success, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of enlightenment, and the Noble Eightfold Path.

analyzed: ime vuccanti santipadā
translated: These are called the peaceful states.

original: Santipadaṁ tāṇapadaṁ leṇapadaṁ saraṇapadaṁ abhayapadaṁ accutapadaṁ amatapadaṁ nibbānapadaṁ brūhi ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehi.
analyzed: santi padam tāṇa padam leṇa padam saraṇa padam abhaya padam accuta padam amata padam nibbāna padam brūhi ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehi
translated: Peaceful state, safe state, protected state, refuge state, fearless state, deathless state, Nibbāna state: explain, teach, make known, set forth, reveal, expound, and make plain.

analyzed: sahaja nettā ati nettam vuccati sabbaññuta ñāṇa
translated: Innate eye: eye is said to be the knowledge of omniscience.

original: Buddhassa bhagavato nettañca jinabhāvo ca bodhiyā mūle apubbaṁ acarimaṁ ekasmiṁ khaṇe uppanno, tasmā buddho sahajanettoti—
analyzed: buddhassa bhagavataḥ nettam ca jina bhāvaḥ ca bodhiyāḥ mūle apubbam acarimam ekasmin khaṇe uppannaḥ tasmā buddhaḥ sahaja netto ti
translated: The eye of the Buddha, the Blessed One, and the state of a victor arose together at the foot of the Bodhi tree, for the first time and the last time. Therefore the Buddha is the one with the innate eye.

analyzed: santipadam brūhi
translated: Peaceful state, explain, with the innate eye.

original: Yathātacchaṁ bhagavā brūhi metanti yathātacchaṁ vuccati amataṁ nibbānaṁ …pe… nirodho nibbānaṁ.
analyzed: yathātaccham bhagavā brūhi mā etat ti yathātaccham vuccati amatam nibbānam pe nirodhaḥ nibbāna
translated: As it really is: the deathless is said to be as it really is … Nibbāna is cessation as it really is.

original: Bhagavāti gāravādhivacanaṁ …pe… sacchikā paññatti, yadidaṁ bhagavāti.
analyzed: bhagavā ati gārava adhivacanam pe sacchikā paññatti yat idam bhagavā ati
translated: Blessed One: this is a term of respect … a description in terms of realization, namely, ‘Blessed One.’🔽Explain: explain, teach, …

analyzed: brūhi mā itanti brūhi ācikkhāhi pe  pakāsehi iti
translated: make plain.

analyzed: yathātaccham bhagavān brūhi mā ita
translated: As it really is: the Blessed One should explain this.

analyzed: tena āha saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: That is what the brahmin meant when he said:

analyzed: sutvān aham vīram akāma kāmi
translated: “Having heard the hero who is free from sensual desire,

analyzed: id ca ayasmai  ogha atigam puṭṭhum akāmam āgama
translated: (said the venerable Jatukaṇṇi.)🔽I’ve come to ask you about the crossing of the flood.🔽Please tell me, Leader of the people,

analyzed: santipadam brūhi
translated: the peaceful state,

analyzed: yathātaccham bhagavā brūhi mā itanti
translated: as it really is, Blessed One.”

analyzed: bhagavā hi kāme abhibhuyya iriyati
translated: The Blessed One abides overcoming sense desires,

analyzed: ādicca uva pathavim tejī tejasā
translated: like the sun, the radiant one, with its radiance on the earth;

analyzed: paritta paññassa me bhūri pañña
translated: I have limited wisdom, you have abundant wisdom,

analyzed: ācikkha dhammam yam aham vijañña
translated: please teach the Dhamma so that I may understand,

analyzed: jāti jarāyaḥ idha vippahāna
translated: the giving up of birth and old age right here.”

analyzed: bhagavā hi kāme abhibhuyya iriyati iti
translated: The Blessed One abides overcoming sense desires:

original: Bhagavāti gāravādhivacanaṁ …pe… sacchikā paññatti, yadidaṁ bhagavāti.
analyzed: bhagavā ati gārava adhivacanam pe sacchikā paññatti yat idam bhagavā ati
translated: Blessed One: this is a term of affection, a term of endearment, a term for one who is excellent, a term for one who is accomplished, a term for one who is foremost, a term for one who is supreme, a term for one who is unsurpassed, a term for one who is incomparable, a term for one who is unique, a term for one who is foremost of persons, a term for the Enlightened One, a term for the Blessed One.

analyzed: kāmā ati uddānataḥ dve kāmā
translated: Sense desires: there are two kinds of sense desires:

analyzed: vatthu kāmā ca kilesa kāmā ca pe
translated: sense desires as objects and sense desires as defilements.

analyzed: ime vuccanti vatthu kāmā pe
translated: These are called sense desires as objects.

analyzed: ime vuccanti kilesa kāmā
translated: These are called sense desires as defilements.

original: Bhagavā vatthukāme parijānitvā kilesakāme pahāya abhibhuyya abhibhavitvā ajjhottharitvā pariyādiyitvā carati viharati iriyati vatteti pāleti yapeti yāpetīti—
analyzed: bhagavā vatthu kāme parijānitvā kilesa kāme pahāya abhibhuyya abhibhavitvā ajjhottharitvā pariyādiyitvā carati viharati iriyati vattā iti pāleti yapeti yāpeti iti
translated: The Blessed One, having fully understood sense desires as objects, having given up sense desires as defilements, abides overcoming sense desires, having conquered them, having expelled them, having crushed them, having scorched them, having uprooted them, having utterly destroyed them, having abandoned them, having relinquished them.

analyzed: bhagavā hi kāme abhibhuyya iriyati
translated: The Blessed One abides overcoming sense desires.

original: Ādiccova pathaviṁ tejī tejasāti ādicco vuccati sūriyo.
analyzed: ādiccaḥ uva pathavim tejī tejasā ati ādiccaḥ vuccati sūriyaḥ
translated: The sun is called the “hot one” because it is hot.

analyzed: pathavī vuccati jagatī
translated: The earth is called the “world” .🔽Just as the sun, being hot and possessing heat, outshines the earth, outshines it, outshines it,

original: Yathā sūriyo tejī tejena samannāgato pathaviṁ abhibhuyya abhibhavitvā ajjhottharitvā🔽pariyādiyitvā santāpayitvā sabbaṁ ākāsagataṁ tamagataṁ abhivihacca andhakāraṁ vidhamitvā
analyzed: yathā sūriyaḥ tejī tejena samannāgataḥ pathavim abhibhuyya abhibhavitvā ajjhottharitvā  pariyādiyitvā santāpayitvā sabbam ākāsa gatam tama gatam abhivihacca andhakāram vidhamitvā
translated: overwhelms it, overpowers it, outshines it,🔽dispels the darkness of the sky and the darkness of the night,🔽shows the light, and moves in the sky, in the firmament, in the expanse of space,

original: ālokaṁ dassayitvā ākāse antalikkhe gaganapathe gacchati, evameva bhagavā ñāṇatejī
analyzed: ālokam dassayitvā ākāse antalikkhe gagana pathe gacchati evam eva bhagavā ñāṇa tejī
translated: so too the Blessed One, being the hot one of knowledge,

analyzed: ñāṇa tejena samannāgataḥ sabbam abhisaṅkhāra samudayam pe
translated: being the hot one of knowledge and possessing the heat of knowledge, outshines the arising of all formations, outshines it, outshines it,🔽outweighs it, outshines it, outshines it,

original: kilesatamaṁ avijjandhakāraṁ vidhamitvā ñāṇālokaṁ dassetvā vatthukāme parijānitvā
analyzed: kilesatamam avijja andhakāram vidhamitvā ñāṇa ālokam dassetvā vatthu kāme parijānitvā
translated: dispels the darkness of defilements and the darkness of ignorance, shows the light of knowledge, understands sensual pleasures as objects,🔽abandons sensual pleasures as defilements, outshines them, outshines them, outshines them,

original: kilesakāme pahāya abhibhuyya abhibhavitvā ajjhottharitvā pariyādiyitvā madditvā carati
analyzed: kilesa kāme pahāya abhibhuyya abhibhavitvā ajjhottharitvā pariyādiyitvā madditvā carati
translated: overwhelms them, overpowers them, outshines them, outshines them, outshines them,🔽walks,

original: viharati iriyati vatteti pāleti yapeti yāpetīti—
analyzed: viharati iriyati vattā iti pāleti yapeti yāpeti iti
translated: lives, dwells, behaves, moves, carries on, subsists, and manages—🔽the Blessed One, being the hot one of knowledge,

analyzed: ādicca uva pathavim tejī tejasā
translated: outshines the earth with the heat of knowledge.

original: Parittapaññassa me bhūripaññāti ahamasmi parittapañño omakapañño lāmakapañño chatukkapañño.
analyzed: paritta paññassa me bhūri paññā ati aham asmi paritta paññaḥ omaka paññaḥ lāmaka paññaḥ chatukka paññaḥ
translated: I have limited understanding, but you have great understanding.

original: Tvampi mahāpañño puthupañño hāsapañño javanapañño tikkhapañño nibbedhikapañño.
analyzed: tvam pi mahā paññaḥ puthu paññaḥ hāsa paññaḥ javana paññaḥ tikkha paññaḥ nibbedhika pañño
translated: You have great understanding, wide understanding, expansive understanding, deep understanding, swift understanding, noble understanding, penetrating understanding.

analyzed: bhūri vuccati pathavī
translated: Great is called earth.

original: Bhagavā tāya pathavisamāya paññāya vipulāya vitthatāya samannāgatoti—
analyzed: bhagavā tāya pathavi samāya paññāya vipulāya vitthatāya samannāgataḥ ti
translated: The Blessed One is endowed with that kind of earth-like understanding, with extensive, wide understanding.

original: parittapaññassa me bhūripañña.🔽Ācikkha dhammaṁ yamahaṁ vijaññanti.🔽Dhammanti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ, cattāro satipaṭṭhāne …pe…
analyzed: paritta paññassa me bhūri pañña  ācikkha dhammam yam aham vijaññanti  ādi kalyāṇam majjhe kalyāṇam pariyosāna kalyāṇam sa attham sa byañjanam kevala paripuṇṇam parisuddham cattāro satipaṭṭhāne pe
translated: I have limited understanding, but you have great understanding.🔽Explain the Dhamma so that I may understand.🔽Dhamma: the Dhamma is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing, and its spiritual life complete and purified.🔽Explain, teach, make known, establish, reveal, expound, and explain the four foundations of mindfulness …

original: nibbānañca nibbānagāminiñca paṭipadaṁ ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehi.
analyzed: nibbānam ca nibbāna gāminim ca paṭipadam ācikkhāhi desehi paññapehi paṭṭhapehi vivarāhi vibhajāhi uttānīkarohi pakāsehi
translated: Nibbana and the path leading to nibbana.

original: Yamahaṁ vijaññanti yamahaṁ jāneyyaṁ ājāneyyaṁ vijāneyyaṁ paṭijāneyyaṁ paṭivijjheyyaṁ adhigaccheyyaṁ phasseyyaṁ sacchikareyyanti—🔽ācikkha dhammaṁ yamahaṁ vijaññaṁ.🔽Jātijarāya idha vippahānanti idheva jātijarāya maraṇassa pahānaṁ vūpasamaṁ paṭinissaggaṁ paṭippassaddhiṁ amataṁ nibbānanti—
analyzed: yam aham vijaññanti yam aham jāneyyam ājāneyyam vijāneyyam paṭijāneyyam paṭivijjheyyam adhigaccheyyam phasseyyam sacchikareyyanti  ācikkha dhammam yam aham vijañña  jāti jarāya idha vippahānam ti idha iva jāti jarāya maraṇassa pahānam vūpasamam paṭinissaggam paṭippassaddhim amatam nibbānam
translated: Explain the Dhamma so that I may know.🔽The ending of birth and old age here: the ending, the stilling, the fading away, the giving up, the relinquishing, the releasing, the letting go of birth and old age, of death, right here, right now, is the deathless, Nibbāna.

analyzed: jāti jarāyaḥ idha vippahāna
translated: The ending of birth and old age here.

analyzed: tena āha saḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: That is what the brahmin said,

analyzed: bhagavā hi kāme abhibhuyya iriyati
translated: “The Blessed One abides overcoming sense desires,

analyzed: ādicca uva pathavim tejī tejasā
translated: Like the sun with its radiance illuminating the earth.

original: Parittapaññassa me bhūripañña,🔽Ācikkha dhammaṁ yamahaṁ vijaññaṁ;
analyzed: paritta paññassa me bhūri pañña  ācikkha dhammam yam aham vijañña
translated: I have limited wisdom, you have abundant wisdom.🔽Explain the Dhamma so that I may know.

analyzed: jāti jarāyaḥ idha vippahānanti
translated: The ending of birth and old age here.”

analyzed: kāmesu vinaya gedha
translated: “Abandon the fetter in regard to sense desires,

analyzed: jatukaṇṇī iti bhagavā
translated: (The Blessed One is called Jatukaṇṇī)

analyzed: nekkhammam daṭṭhu khemataḥ
translated: Seeing renunciation as the safe course.

analyzed: uggahitam nirattam vā
translated: Whether you are taken or not taken,

analyzed: mā te vijjittha kiñcana
translated: Let there be nothing that you cling to.

analyzed: kāmesu vinaya gedhanti
translated: Abandon the fetter in regard to sense desires.

analyzed: kāmā ati uddānataḥ dve kāmā
translated: “Sense desires”: there are two kinds of sense desires:

analyzed: vatthu kāmā ca kilesa kāmā ca pe
translated: sensual desires as objects and sensual desires as defilements …

analyzed: ime vuccanti vatthu kāmā pe
translated: these are called sensual desires as objects …

analyzed: ime vuccanti kilesa kāmā
translated: these are called sensual desires as defilements.

original: Gedhanti gedho vuccati taṇhā.🔽Yo rāgo sārāgo …pe… abhijjhā lobho akusalamūlaṁ.
analyzed: gedhanti gedhaḥ vuccati taṇhā  yaḥ rāgaḥ sa arāgaḥ pe abhijjhā lobho akusala mūla
translated: Craving: craving is called ‘craving’.🔽It is passion, delight, infatuation, thirst, craving, attachment, grasping, mental standing, adherence, and appearance as an object.

original: Kāmesu vinaya gedhanti kāmesu gedhaṁ vinaya paṭivinaya pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvaṁ gamehīti—
analyzed: kāmesu vinaya kāmesu gedham vinaya paṭivinaya pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvam gamehi iti
translated: Abandon craving for sensual desires: abandon craving for sensual desires, give it up, relinquish it, let it go, do not hold on to it.

analyzed: kāmesu vinaya gedha
translated: Abandon craving for sensual desires.

original: Jatukaṇṇīti bhagavā taṁ brāhmaṇaṁ gottena ālapati.
analyzed: jatukaṇṇī iti bhagavā tam brāhmaṇam gottena ālapati
translated: Jatukaṇṇi: the Blessed One is addressing that brahmin by his clan name.

original: Bhagavāti gāravādhivacanametaṁ …pe… sacchikā paññatti, yadidaṁ bhagavāti—
analyzed: bhagavā ati gārava adhivacanam etam pe sacchikā paññatti yat idam bhagavā ati
translated: Bhagavā: this is a term of respect … a designation for one who has realized the truth.

analyzed: jatukaṇṇī iti bhagavā
translated: Jatukaṇṇi: the Blessed One.

original: Nekkhammaṁ daṭṭhu khematoti.🔽Nekkhammanti sammāpaṭipadaṁ anulomapaṭipadaṁ apaccanīkapaṭipadaṁ anvatthapaṭipadaṁ
analyzed: nekkhammam daṭṭhu khemato ti  nekkhammanti sammā paṭipadam anuloma paṭipadam apaccanīka paṭipadam anvattha paṭipada
translated: See renunciation as security:

original: dhammānudhammapaṭipadaṁ sīlesu paripūrakāritaṁ indriyesu guttadvārataṁ bhojane mattaññutaṁ
analyzed: dhamma anudhamma paṭipadam sīlesu paripūra kāritam indriyesu gutta dvāra tam bhojane
translated: Renunciation: right practice, practice in accordance with the Dhamma, practice that is proper, practice that is in conformity with the Dhamma, practice in accordance with the Teacher’s instructions, fulfilling virtue, guarding the sense doors, moderation in eating,

original: jāgariyānuyogaṁ satisampajaññaṁ cattāro satipaṭṭhāne cattāro sammappadhāne cattāro
analyzed: jāgariya anuyogam sati sampajaññam cattāraḥ sati paṭṭhāne cattāraḥ sammappadhāne cattāraḥ
translated: the practice of being watchful, mindfulness and full awareness, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of success,

original: iddhipāde pañcindriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjhaṅge ariyaṁ aṭṭhaṅgikaṁ maggaṁ nibbānañca
analyzed: iddhipāde pañca indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjhaṅge ariyam aṭṭhaṅgikam maggam nibbānañca
translated: the practice of staying awake, mindfulness and clear awareness, the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of spiritual success, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path, Nibbāna,

original: nibbānagāminiñca paṭipadaṁ khemato tāṇato leṇato saraṇato saraṇībhūtato abhayato🔽accutato amatato nibbānato daṭṭhuṁ passitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtaṁ katvāti—
analyzed: nibbāna gāminim ca paṭipadam khemataḥ tāṇataḥ leṇataḥ saraṇataḥ saraṇībhūtataḥ abhayataḥ  accutataḥ amatataḥ nibbānataḥ daṭṭhum passitvā tulayitvā tīrayitvā vibhāvayitvā vibhūtam katvā iti
translated: and the path that leads to Nibbāna, as a safe place, as protection, as a shelter, as a refuge, as a haven, as a last resort, as peace,🔽as the supreme security from bondage, as the deathless, as Nibbāna.🔽Having seen, having closely looked at, having properly contemplated, having properly discerned, having properly investigated, having properly defined,

analyzed: nekkhammam daṭṭhu khemataḥ
translated: he sees renunciation as a safe place.

analyzed: uggahitam nirattam vāti
translated: What is grasped at should be let go.

original: Uggahitanti taṇhāvasena diṭṭhivasena gahitaṁ parāmaṭṭhaṁ abhiniviṭṭhaṁ ajjhositaṁ adhimuttaṁ.
analyzed: uggahitanti taṇhā vasena diṭṭhi vasena gahitam parāmaṭṭham abhiniviṭṭham ajjhositam adhimutta
translated: Grasped at: grasped at through craving, grasped at through views, grasped at, clung to, taken as “mine,” taken as an identity.

original: Nirattaṁ vāti nirattaṁ vā muñcitabbaṁ vijahitabbaṁ vinoditabbaṁ byantīkātabbaṁ anabhāvaṁ gametabbanti—
analyzed: nirattam vā ati nirattam vā muñcitabbam vijahitabbam vinoditabbam byantīkātabbam anabhāvam gametabbanti
translated: What is grasped at should be let go: it should be let go, given up, abandoned, relinquished, forsaken.

analyzed: uggahitam nirattam vā
translated: What is grasped at should be let go.

original: Mā te vijjittha kiñcananti rāgakiñcanaṁ dosakiñcanaṁ mohakiñcanaṁ mānakiñcanaṁ diṭṭhikiñcanaṁ kilesakiñcanaṁ duccaritakiñcanaṁ.
analyzed: mā te vijjittha kiñcananti rāga kiñcanam dosa kiñcanam moha kiñcanam māna kiñcanam diṭṭhi kiñcanam kilesa kiñcanam duccarita kiñcana
translated: Don’t let there be any possessions for you: possessions of sensuality, possessions of ill will, possessions of confusion, possessions of conceit, possessions of views, possessions of defilements, possessions of misconduct.

original: Idaṁ kiñcanaṁ tuyhaṁ mā vijjittha mā pavijjittha mā saṁvijjittha pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvaṁ gamehīti—
analyzed: idam kiñcanam tuyham mā vijjittha mā pavijjittha mā savijjittha pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvam gamehi iti
translated: Don’t let there be any of these possessions for you. Don’t let them be, don’t let them come to be, don’t let them be present. Abandon them, transcend them, totally go beyond them, and put an end to them.

analyzed: mā te vijjittha kiñcana
translated: Don’t let there be any possessions for you.

analyzed: tena āha bhagavān
translated: That’s why the Buddha said:

analyzed: kāmesu vinaya gedha
translated: “Give up attachment to sensuality,

analyzed: jatukaṇṇī iti bhagavā
translated: (the Buddha said to Jatukaṇṇi)

analyzed: nekkhammam daṭṭhu khemataḥ
translated: And see renunciation as safe.

analyzed: uggahitam nirattam vā
translated: Whether you’re taken hold of or not,

analyzed: mā te vijjittha kiñcananti
translated: Don’t let there be any possessions for you.”

analyzed: yam pubbe tam visosehi
translated: “Get rid of what’s in the past,

analyzed: pacchā te mā āhuḥ kiñcana
translated: and don’t plan for the future.

analyzed: majjhe ce naḥ gahessasi
translated: If you don’t grasp at the present,

analyzed: upasantaḥ carissasi
translated: you’ll live at peace.

original: Yaṁ pubbe taṁ visosehīti atīte saṅkhāre ārabbha ye kilesā uppajjeyyuṁ te kilese sosehi
analyzed: yam pubbe tam visosehi iti atīte saṅkhāre ārabbha ye kilesāḥ uppajjeyyum te kilese sosehi
translated: Get rid of what’s in the past: with regard to past phenomena, get rid of, get free from, and fully understand whatever defilements might arise.

original: visosehi sukkhāpehi visukkhāpehi abījaṁ karohi pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvaṁ gamehīti—
analyzed: visosehi sukkhāpehi visukkhāpehi abījam karohi pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvam gamehi iti
translated: Get rid of them, get free from them, and fully understand them. Make them seedless, abandon them, transcend them, totally go beyond them, and put an end to them.

analyzed: evam pi yam pubbe tam visosehi
translated: In this way, too, you should get rid of what is in the past.

original: Atha vā ye atītā kammābhisaṅkhārā avipakkavipākā te kammābhisaṅkhāre sosehi visosehi sukkhāpehi visukkhāpehi abījaṁ karohi pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvaṁ gamehīti—
analyzed: atha vā ye atītā kamma abhisaṅkhārāḥ a vipakka vipākā te kamma abhisaṅkhāre sosehi visosehi sukkhāpehi visukkhāpehi abījam karohi pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvam gamehi iti
translated: Or else, you should get rid of, get free from, cut off, destroy, and make it unable to arise again in the future, that is, you should abandon, destroy, and make it disappear completely.

original: evampi yaṁ pubbe taṁ visosehi.🔽Pacchā te māhu kiñcananti pacchā vuccati anāgate saṅkhāre ārabbha rāgakiñcanaṁ dosakiñcanaṁ mohakiñcanaṁ mānakiñcanaṁ diṭṭhikiñcanaṁ kilesakiñcanaṁ duccaritakiñcanaṁ.
analyzed: evam pi yam pubbe tam visosehi  pacchā te mā āhu kiñcananti pacchā vuccati anāgate saṅkhāre ārabbha rāga kiñcanam dosa kiñcanam moha kiñcanam māna kiñcanam diṭṭhi kiñcanam kilesa kiñcanam duccarita kiñcana
translated: In this way, too, you should get rid of what is in the past.

original: Idaṁ kiñcanaṁ tuyhaṁ mā ahu mā ahosi mā janesi mā sañjanesi mābhinibbattesi pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvaṁ gamehīti—
analyzed: idam kiñcanam tuyham mā ahu mā ahosi mā janesi mā sañjanesi mā abhinibbattesi pajaha vinodehi byantīkarohi anabhāvam gamehi iti
translated: Don’t have any concern for the future. The future is what is not yet come, that is, future choices. Don’t have any concern for them, don’t have any desire, passion, or affection for them. Don’t give rise to, don’t produce, don’t create, and don’t form them. Abandon, destroy, and make them disappear completely.

analyzed: pacchā te mā āhuḥ kiñcana
translated: Don’t have any concern for the future.

original: Majjhe ce no gahessasīti majjhe vuccati paccuppannaṁ rūpaṁ vedanā saññā saṅkhārā viññāṇaṁ.
analyzed: majjhe ce naḥ gahessasi iti majjhe vuccati paccuppannam rūpam vedanā saññā saṅkhārāḥ viññāṇa
translated: If you don’t grasp at the present. The present is what is seen, heard, thought, known, attained, sought after, and pondered by the intellect.

original: Paccuppanne saṅkhāre taṇhāvasena diṭṭhivasena na gahessasi na gaṇhissasi na parāmasissasi na nandissasi nābhinandissasi na ajjhosissasi.
analyzed: paccuppanne saṅkhāre taṇhā vasena diṭṭhi vasena na gahessasi na gaṇhissasi na parāmasissasi na nandissasi na abhinandissasi na ajjhosissasi
translated: You will not grasp at present formations by craving or by views.

original: Abhinandanaṁ abhivadanaṁ ajjhosānaṁ gāhaṁ parāmāsaṁ abhinivesaṁ pajahissasi vinodessasi byantīkarissasi anabhāvaṁ gamessasīti—
analyzed: abhinandanam abhivadanam ajjhosānam gāham parāmāsam abhinivesam pajahissasi vinodessasi byantīkarissasi anabhāvam gamessasi iti
translated: You will abandon, do away with, make disappear, and annihilate delighting, welcoming, and relishing, grasping, holding, and misapprehending.🔽If you do not grasp in the middle,

original: majjhe ce no gahessasi.🔽Upasanto carissasīti rāgassa upasamitattā upasanto carissasi, dosassa …pe…🔽sabbākusalābhisaṅkhārānaṁ santattā samitattā upasamitattā vūpasamitattā nijjhātattā🔽nibbutattā vigatattā paṭippassaddhattā santo upasanto vūpasanto nibbuto paṭippassaddho🔽carissasi viharissasi iriyissasi vattissasi pālessasi yapessasi yāpessasīti—

translated: You will live in peace.

analyzed: assa ati arahataḥ khīṇāsavassa
translated: Assa: of the one who has destroyed the effluents, of the one without effluents.

original: Na vijjantīti ime āsavā tassa natthi na santi na saṁvijjanti nupalabbhanti pahīnā samucchinnā vūpasantā paṭippassaddhā abhabbuppattikā ñāṇagginā daḍḍhāti—
analyzed: na vijjanti iti ime āsavā tassa natthi na santi na na upalabbhanti pahīnā samucchinnā vūpasantā paṭippassaddhā abhabbuppattikā ñāṇa agginā daḍḍhā ati
translated: Do not exist: these effluents do not exist for him, are not, have ceased, are cut off at the root, are uprooted, are done away with, are not liable to arise in the future. They are burned up by the fire of knowledge.

analyzed: āsavāssa na vijjanti
translated: His effluents do not exist.

original: Yehi maccuvasaṁ vajeti yehi āsavehi maccuno vā vasaṁ gaccheyya, maraṇassa vā vasaṁ gaccheyya, mārapakkhassa vā vasaṁ gaccheyya;
analyzed: yehi maccu vasam vaja iti yehi āsavehi maccunaḥ vā vasam gaccheyya maraṇassa vā vasam gaccheyya māra pakkhassa vā vasam gaccheyya
translated: By which he would come under the sway of death: by which effluents he would come under the sway of the one who has death, or come under the sway of death, or come under the sway of Māra’s faction,

original: te āsavā tassa natthi na santi na saṁvijjanti nupalabbhanti pahīnā samucchinnā vūpasantā paṭippassaddhā abhabbuppattikā ñāṇagginā daḍḍhāti—🔽yehi maccuvasaṁ vaje.🔽Tenāha bhagavā—
analyzed: te āsavā tassa natthi na santi na sa vijjanti na upalabbhanti pahīnā samucchinnā vūpasantā paṭippassaddhā abhabbuppattikā ñāṇa agginā daḍḍhā ati  yehi maccuvasam vaje  tena āha bhagavān
translated: They are not his, they are absent, they are not manifest, they are not found in him, they are given up, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated so that they are no more subject to future arising.🔽He would be subject to Death’s control.🔽That is why the Blessed One said:🔽🔽

original: “Sabbaso nāmarūpasmiṁ,🔽vītagedhassa brāhmaṇa;🔽Āsavāssa na vijjanti,🔽yehi maccuvasaṁ vaje”ti.🔽Saha gāthāpariyosānā …pe…🔽satthā me bhante bhagavā, sāvakohamasmīti.🔽Jatukaṇṇimāṇavapucchāniddeso ekādasamo.
analyzed: sabbasaḥ nāma rūpasmi 🔽vītagedhassa brāhmaṇa 🔽āsavāssa na vijjanti 🔽yā ihi mat cuvasam vaja iti 🔽saha gāthā pariyosānā pe 🔽satthā me bhante bhagavā sāvakaḥ ham asmi iti 🔽jatukaṇṇi māṇavapucchā niddesaḥ ekādasamaḥ
translated: He has no effluents, none that remain, none that are manifest, none that have not been fully understood.
